intro: Callista triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered callista, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Callista triflora is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
